title: Crossrail (Elizabeth Line)
description: A major new railway for London and the South East.
statusRationale: Project complete.

evidence.title: Crossrail Completion Report
evidence.description: Final project report for the Elizabeth Line.

title: High Speed 2 (HS2) Phase 1
description: A new high-capacity, high-speed railway connecting London and the West Midlands, via the existing West Coast Main Line.
statusRationale: Delivery confidence is low; the project is being re-baselined after scope reductions (Network North) and cost estimate updates.

evidence.title: HS2 Official Website
evidence.description: Official information and updates on HS2.

title: High Speed 2 (HS2) Phase 2b / Northern Powerhouse Rail
description: Extending high-speed rail in the North and Midlands, integrating HS2 Phase 2b with the Northern Powerhouse Rail network to improve east–west and north–south connectivity.
statusRationale: Project realigned to the Integrated Rail Plan; delivery timeline extended to mid-2040s in line with target year. Benefits have been revised down due to scope changes.

title: East West Rail – Connection Stage 1
description: The East West Rail (EWR) scheme will create a new rail link from Oxford to Cambridge:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}. Connection Stage 1 delivers the section between Oxford, Bicester, Milton Keynes and Bedford.
statusRationale: Delivery is feasible but faces schedule and funding challenges as construction progresses.

title: East West Rail – Connection Stages 2 & 3
description: Later phases of East West Rail extending the new Oxford–Cambridge railway from Bedford through to Cambridge:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.
statusRationale: Successful delivery appears unachievable under current plans, pending funding and route approval for the Bedford–Cambridge sections.

title: Lower Thames Crossing
description: A proposed new dual–carriageway road and tunnel under the River Thames east of London, connecting Kent and Essex:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}.
statusRationale: Awaiting planning consent; project timeline and cost under review but still progressing through design and enabling works.

title: A303 Amesbury to Berwick Down (Stonehenge Tunnel)
description: Upgrade of the A303 near Stonehenge to a dual carriageway, including a new twin-bore tunnel under the World Heritage Site.
statusRationale: Project remains on hold pending conclusion of legal challenges to its planning approval, introducing uncertainty to cost and schedule.

title: A12 Chelmsford to A120 Widening
description: Widening the A12 to three lanes between Chelmsford (junction 19) and the A120 interchange (junction 25) in Essex, to increase capacity and reduce congestion.
statusRationale: Legal challenge to the project’s Development Consent Order is creating schedule uncertainty, although all development milestones to date were achieved.

title: A66 Northern Trans-Pennine Upgrade
description: Upgrading the remaining six single-carriageway sections of the A66 between the A1(M) at Scotch Corner and the M6 at Penrith to dual carriageway, including key junction improvements.
statusRationale: Development Consent was granted in March 2024. Final business case and start of works are pending, with assurance reviews planned to manage remaining risks.

title: A428 Black Cat to Caxton Gibbet
description: Construction of a new 10-mile dual carriageway between the Black Cat roundabout (A1) in Bedfordshire and Caxton Gibbet roundabout (A428) in Cambridgeshire, including a new junction at Black Cat.
statusRationale: Full business case approved and construction started in late 2023, improving delivery confidence.

title: A417 "Air Balloon" Improvement
description: Upgrading the A417 in Gloucestershire by building a new dual carriageway to replace a winding single-lane stretch near Birdlip (the "Air Balloon"), improving safety and connectivity.
statusRationale: Work is underway ahead of schedule. An assurance review in late 2022 rated the project Green, with all recommendations addressed.

title: Transpennine Route Upgrade (TRU)
description: Major rail upgrade between York, Leeds and Manchester to electrify the route and enhance capacity, speed and reliability across the Transpennine corridor.
statusRationale: Facing cost and schedule pressures due to scope increases and high inflation:contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}, but project delivery continues with phased works underway.

title: East Coast Digital Programme
description: Introduction of in-cab digital signaling (European Train Control System) on the southern East Coast Main Line from London King’s Cross to south of Grantham, replacing lineside signals with modern train-to-track communication.
statusRationale: Innovative first-of-kind deployment in UK rail—delivery is feasible but requires managing industry-wide change and technical integration risks.

title: Midland Main Line Electrification (Phase 3)
description: Electrification and upgrade of the Midland Main Line north of Kettering, extending electric train operation towards Nottingham, Derby and Sheffield to increase capacity and cut journey times.
statusRationale: Delivery is underway in stages. Recent cost pressures and schedule adjustments keep the project in an Amber status as work progresses.

title: Sizewell C New Nuclear Power Station
description: Proposed 3.2 GW nuclear power plant in Suffolk (twin EPR reactors) developed by EDF and the UK government to provide low-carbon electricity and support energy security.
statusRationale: Delivery confidence information is commercially sensitive and has been withheld:contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}. Government negotiations on financing and contracts are ongoing.

title: Carbon Capture, Usage and Storage (CCUS) Clusters Programme
description: A programme to deliver industrial-scale carbon capture and storage in at least two UK industrial clusters by the mid-2020s and two further clusters by 2030:contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}, capturing 20–30 million tonnes CO₂ annually by 2030.
statusRationale: Delivery confidence details are withheld for commercial reasons:contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}. The programme is proceeding with Track-1 cluster projects and further cluster selections pending funding decisions.

title: Geological Disposal Facility (GDF) for Radioactive Waste
description: A nationally significant infrastructure programme to identify a willing host community and construct a deep Geological Disposal Facility for the permanent, safe disposal of the UK’s higher-activity radioactive waste:contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}.
statusRationale: The DCA is Amber reflecting considerable uncertainty around site selection, geology and technical feasibility at this stage:contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}. Progress is being made with three Community Partnerships engaged in detailed evaluations.

title: Great British Nuclear (SMR Programme)
description: Establishment of Great British Nuclear (GBN) as a delivery body to develop new nuclear capacity, starting with a competitive selection of Small Modular Reactor technologies and preparation of sites for up to 24 GW of nuclear by 2050:contentReference[oaicite:26]{index=26}.
statusRationale: Delivery status is commercially sensitive (project in early procurement stages):contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}. The SMR technology competition and site identification are underway, but timelines depend on industry responses.

title: Green Heat Network Fund (GHNF)
description: A £288 million capital grant scheme to incentivise the transition of heating networks to low-carbon sources at scale, driving carbon savings and increased use of heat pumps, waste heat and other low-carbon heat in networks:contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}.
statusRationale: Additional funding in 2023 extended the programme through 2027/28, and delivery confidence improved from Amber to Green as the scheme’s pipeline and support systems have been strengthened:contentReference[oaicite:29]{index=29}.

title: Home Upgrade Grant & Local Authority Delivery (HULA) Schemes
description: Programmes providing grants to upgrade energy efficiency and low-carbon heating in fuel-poor homes in England. The Home Upgrade Grant (HUG) targets off-gas-grid homes, and the Local Authority Delivery (LAD) scheme (Phases 1–3) retrofitted low-performing homes via local councils:contentReference[oaicite:30]{index=30}:contentReference[oaicite:31]{index=31}.
statusRationale: Rated Amber due to under-delivery against initial targets in earlier phases (lower uptake and project delays):contentReference[oaicite:32]{index=32}. Programme adjustments (more support for local authorities, policy tweaks) are being implemented to improve delivery:contentReference[oaicite:33]{index=33}.

title: Social Housing Decarbonisation Fund (SHDF)
description: A £3.8 billion programme to retrofit England’s social housing stock to EPC Band C energy efficiency by 2030, delivered in waves (a £60m demonstrator, £179m Wave 1, £778m Wave 2.1, etc.) to upgrade hundreds of thousands of homes:contentReference[oaicite:34]{index=34}:contentReference[oaicite:35]{index=35}.
statusRationale: Wave 1 is concluding successfully, but future waves must accelerate installation rates to meet targets:contentReference[oaicite:36]{index=36}. An IPA review in March 2024 rated the upcoming Wave 3 Amber, reflecting these delivery challenges:contentReference[oaicite:37]{index=37}.

title: Spherical Tokamak for Energy Production (STEP)
description: A staged programme to design and build, by around 2040, a prototype fusion energy plant delivering net energy and demonstrating the commercial viability of fusion power:contentReference[oaicite:38]{index=38}. The STEP prototype will be a world-first, paving the way for a global fusion energy market.
statusRationale: An ambitious, high-risk research programme – the IPA’s delivery confidence remains Amber given the scale of technological challenges, even as early Tranche 1 objectives were met on schedule:contentReference[oaicite:39]{index=39}:contentReference[oaicite:40]{index=40}.

title: BEPPS2 (Sellafield Box Encapsulation Plant Product Store 2)
description: Construction of a modern intermediate-level radioactive waste storage facility at Sellafield. BEPPS2 will safely encapsulate and store ~7,470 packages of legacy ILW retrieved from older silos, with a design life of 100 years:contentReference[oaicite:41]{index=41}:contentReference[oaicite:42]{index=42}.
statusRationale: The project is on track against its approved baseline plan:contentReference[oaicite:43]{index=43}. No significant threats to the 2035 completion date have emerged, and delivery is proceeding within strategic tolerances.

title: Dreadnought Submarine Programme
description: Programme to design and build four new Dreadnought-class ballistic missile submarines to replace the Royal Navy’s Vanguard-class, sustaining the UK’s continuous at-sea nuclear deterrent into the 2030s and beyond:contentReference[oaicite:44]{index=44}.
statusRationale: The programme remains on track for HMS Dreadnought (first of class) to enter service in the early 2030s:contentReference[oaicite:45]{index=45}. However, it is inherently high-risk and complex; substantial schedule and technical contingencies are being managed (delivery confidence rated Amber).

title: Future Combat Air System (FCAS / Tempest)
description: International programme (UK, Italy, Japan) to develop a sixth-generation fighter aircraft system to replace the RAF Typhoon fleet from the mid-2030s:contentReference[oaicite:46]{index=46}:contentReference[oaicite:47]{index=47}. FCAS will include a new stealth combat aircraft and a suite of adjunct systems (such as drones and advanced networking).
statusRationale: Early-stage development: the tri-nation Global Combat Air Programme was launched in 2023. Delivery confidence is Amber, acknowledging the scale of the technological and management challenge to deliver a new fighter in the required timeframe:contentReference[oaicite:48]{index=48}.

title: Type 26 Frigate Programme
description: Construction of eight Type 26 "City-class" frigates for the Royal Navy, advanced anti-submarine warfare warships replacing the Type 23. Three ships (Batch 1) are under construction on the Clyde, with five Batch 2 to follow.
statusRationale: Shipbuilding is underway, but the programme has experienced schedule delays and cost growth due to design changes and supply chain challenges. Delivery confidence remains Amber as the first ships near completion.

title: Type 31 Frigate Programme
description: Programme to build five Type 31 "Inspiration-class" general purpose frigates in Rosyth for the Royal Navy, providing a capable and flexible warship at lower cost, with all five planned to be in service by 2030.
statusRationale: The programme is progressing well against an aggressive timeline. Construction of the lead ship is on track, and no major issues have been reported, yielding a Green delivery confidence status.

title: AJAX Armoured Fighting Vehicle Programme
description: Procurement of 589 Ajax armoured fighting vehicles for the British Army, intended to transform its armoured reconnaissance capability. The vehicles feature advanced sensors and weaponry on a tracked platform.
statusRationale: Significant performance problems (noise/vibration issues) halted trials for prolonged periods. As a result, the programme is severely delayed and over budget, with the IPA rating it Red (delivery of operational vehicles still uncertain).

title: Challenger 3 Main Battle Tank Upgrade
description: Life-Extension Programme to upgrade 148 Challenger 2 tanks to Challenger 3 standard, featuring a new turret with a 120mm smoothbore gun, improved sights, armour, engine and electronic architecture:contentReference[oaicite:49]{index=49}.
statusRationale: Upgrades are in early prototyping. The project is Amber due to tight delivery timescales and dependency on a single prime contractor. Recent cost increases (from £1.435 bn to £1.987 bn Whole Life Cost) reflect scope additions:contentReference[oaicite:50]{index=50}, which are being managed within revised budgets.

title: Skynet 6 MILSATCOM Programme
description: Next-generation military satellite communications system for UK forces, replacing Skynet 5. Involves new satellites (Skynet 6A and follow-ons) and ground infrastructure to provide secure beyond-line-of-sight communications worldwide.
statusRationale: One satellite (Skynet 6A) is under construction following some contracting delays. Overall schedule confidence is Amber as the MoD finalizes requirements and procurement for subsequent satellites and ground segment upgrades.

title: Clyde Submarine Infrastructure Programme
description: Major upgrade of HMNB Clyde (Faslane) facilities to support the Royal Navy’s entire submarine fleet at a single site. Includes new dock, engineering and training facilities to accommodate Dreadnought-class submarines and sustain Continuous At-Sea Deterrence:contentReference[oaicite:51]{index=51}.
statusRationale: This £1.8 billion infrastructure programme is complex and has little schedule float relative to Dreadnought submarine delivery. It is in the early construction phase with an Amber status, reflecting the need to closely manage construction risks to meet the required in-service date.

title: Emergency Services Network (ESN) / ESMCP
description: Home Office-led Emergency Services Mobile Communications Programme (ESMCP) to replace the Airwave system with a new 4G-based Emergency Services Network. ESN will provide mission-critical voice and data for police, fire and ambulance over an enhanced commercial 4G LTE network:contentReference[oaicite:52]{index=52}.
statusRationale: The IPA continues to rate ESN delivery as Red:contentReference[oaicite:53]{index=53}. While re-procurement of key contracts is in progress, the programme has repeatedly missed milestones and the transition from Airwave has been delayed indefinitely pending a viable revised plan.

title: Digital Services at the Border (DSAB)
description: A programme delivering new digital border systems to transform how UK Border Force and partner agencies operate. DSAB provides modern systems for border crossings, visa processing, security checks and data sharing, replacing legacy IT:contentReference[oaicite:54]{index=54}.
statusRationale: Core releases have gone live, but some planned capabilities have been descoped or delayed. The Amber rating reflects schedule slippage and the need to integrate with other Home Office immigration and border systems still in development.

title: GOV.UK One Login Programme
description: A cross-government programme to implement a single digital identity and login system for all UK government services. One Login will allow citizens to prove their identity once and access multiple online services securely, replacing older systems like GOV.UK Verify:contentReference[oaicite:55]{index=55}.
statusRationale: The programme is progressing, with 30 services integrated and 4.1 million users onboarded:contentReference[oaicite:56]{index=56}. However, it faces significant technical complexity and resource challenges; the IPA has flagged multiple delivery risks (hence an Amber status).

title: New Hospital Programme (40 Hospitals by 2030)
description: A flagship DHSC programme to deliver 40 new hospitals across England by 2030, involving a standardised “Hospital 2.0” design and modular construction approach, plus major rebuilds of aging hospital facilities:contentReference[oaicite:57]{index=57}.
statusRationale: The IPA has rated the New Hospital Programme as Red:contentReference[oaicite:58]{index=58} – successful delivery appears unachievable as originally planned. Project delays, cost inflation, and scope changes mean later phases are at high risk of not being delivered by 2030 without significant replanning and additional funding.

title: Prison Estate Capacity Programme
description: Ministry of Justice programme to create thousands of new prison places by building new prisons and expanding existing ones. Includes construction of modern prisons (e.g. HMP Five Wells, HMP Fosse Way) and additional houseblocks to address overcrowding and future demand.
statusRationale: The programme is delivering new facilities but has faced planning and procurement delays. Several new prisons are under construction, but the overall schedule to add 20,000 prison places by the mid-2020s remains challenging (Amber status).

title: HMCTS Court Reform Programme
description: A transformation programme to modernise the courts and tribunals of England and Wales through digitisation, modern case management IT, and rationalisation of the court estate. It aims to streamline processes and improve access to justice by moving services online.
statusRationale: Delivery has been delayed, and scope reduced in areas such as online criminal proceedings. While many digital services have been implemented, the overall programme is rated Amber due to user adoption challenges and the need for further legislative changes to fully realize benefits.

title: Thames Tideway Tunnel
description: A 25-km "super-sewer" tunnel under London’s River Thames to capture and store combined sewage overflows, preventing pollution. The Tideway Tunnel will run from Acton to Beckton, largely following the Thames, and work with the Lee Tunnel to modernise London’s Victorian sewer system.
statusRationale: Now over 90% complete, the project is on course to be operational by around 2025. It remains Amber due to residual construction risks and the complex system commissioning phase, but overall is progressing within its revised schedule and budget:contentReference[oaicite:59]{index=59}.

evidence.title: Tideway Construction Update
evidence.summary: Construction is progressing with some delays due to supply chain issues.

title: Customs Declaration Service (CDS)
description: HMRC’s IT system replacement for handling import/export customs declarations. CDS replaces the old CHIEF system to accommodate post-Brexit customs volumes and more complex requirements, providing a modern platform for traders to submit declarations.
statusRationale: CDS has successfully onboarded the vast majority of traders (import declarations fully migrated in 2022). Delivery is essentially complete with remaining functionality (exports) on track, hence a Green status.
